newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to host China experts at futures seminar.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to host China experts at futures seminar.

text.p: A private Taiwan futures industry group said on Tuesday it would stage a conference on futures markets and trading with officials from China.
Officials from the Taipei Futures Association said the two sides would meet on March 11.
No government officials were scheduled to participate in the conference, association officials said.
The Chinese delegation would include 15 presidents and chairmen of major futures exchanges and companies within the industry.
The delegates will stay in Taiwan from March 10-16, officials said.
Taiwan has said it wants to develop local futures trading but postponed a start to 1998 from October 1997 because of legislative bickering that has delayed passage of the Futures Trading Law.

Economic exchanges between rivals Taiwan and China, separated after a bitter civil war in 1949, have flourished since an unofficial thaw began in the 1980s. But Taipei still forbids direct official contacts with Beijing.
